Prototype Conformance Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

The server offers read and search support on the following resource types:

  • Patient
  • DocumentReference
  • Condition
  • DiagnosticReport

name: PHR Template
description: Prototype Conformance Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

fhir_comments: while the FHIR infrastructure is turning over prior to development, a version is required. Note that this may be rescinded later
this is not particularly important for this usage (server doesn't accept any content), but we have to provide it anyway
for the connectathon, servers should support both xml and json. Clients can use only one.

rest.documentation: Protoype server conformance statement for September 2013 Connectathon

security.description: We recommend that PHR servers use standard OAuth using a          standard 3rd party provider. We are not testing the ability to provide an          OAuth authentication/authorization service itself, and nor is providing          any security required for the connectathon at all

fhir_comments: patient resource: read and search for patients the authenticated user has access too

interaction.documentation: When a client searches patients with no search criteria, they get a list of all patients they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

fhir_comments: document reference resource: read and search

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: _id parameter always supported. For the connectathon, servers may elect which search parameters are supported

fhir_comments: for the purposes of the connectathon, servers can choose which additional resources to support. Here's a couple of examples
Condition - let the patient see a list of their Conditions
Diagnostic Reports - can be lots of these, so we'll suggest that at least service category should be supported as a search criteria

searchParam.name: service
searchParam.documentation: which diagnostic discipline/department created the report
